title: What are YOU most like?
content:
Well since everyone is creating topics about religion, I might as well too. Although I chose something that can't cause controversy.

[url=http://quizfarm.com/test.php?q_id=10907]What religion do you share the most views with?[/url]

This test/quiz is one of the best ones I have taken. I got accurate results too.

Buddhism 67%
Christianity 67%
Paganism 67%
agnosticism 63%
Judaism 46%
Islam 42%
Satanism 42%
Hinduism 38%
atheism 17%

What did you get?-----------------------
"The Adventures of Commander Keen" issue #1: [img]http://img170.imageshack.us/img170/5541/newteaserdarker1xh.png[/img]
"Fat people buy lots"

title: Re: What are YOU most like?
content:
Christianity 88%
Islam 50%
Judaism 46%
Buddhism 33%
Paganism 33%
Hinduism 29%
--------
agnosticism 17%
Satanism 13%
atheism 4%

If I remember correct I got 100% Islam in some of these tests, although it probably wasn't this one.. Anyways, but this is accurate in the sense I got Christianity to top one. Anyways, I ruled the last three out with some lines since they are not religions. As well, as far as I know I'm not agnostic at all, dunno how that test counts those.Eat your veggies!

title: Re: What are YOU most like?
Meh.
content:
Buddhism 83%
Paganism 83%
Hinduism 79%
Christianity 71%
Satanism 63%
agnosticism 63%
Islam 54%
atheism&nbsp &nbsp &nbsp &nbsp 29%
Judaism&nbsp &nbsp &nbsp &nbsp 25%

I prefer not to identify with any particular religion, though. Whatever brings good results.Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

title: Re: Meh.
content:
This test is worse than the usual. What should someone answer to this one if one did not believed in either God or Jesus? "There is only one God, and He is not Jesus."
Those creating this test were a bit biased towards believing that everyone should be at least religious. Is satanism close to ateism? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

The other questions that are not for thouse who are not religious are:

"God's existence cannot yet be proven" yet??
"Women and men are equal in the eyes of God"
"The many gods are all part of one larger being."
"The strongest spiritual connection I feel is in nature." What is spiritual connections?
"God does not ever have a physical, nor human body."
"Jesus, being a prophet, should be respected; however, being a man, not be worshipped." What does disagree or agree mean here?
"People are not inherently evil; they are just weak and have free will." This would mean that either they are evil or weak?

This I simply don't understand:
"Sex is the woman's right, not the man's" So I cannot be male? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] (just joking here [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] )

atheism 92%
Satanism 88%
Paganism 58%
Buddhism 50%
Judaism 33%
agnosticism 33%
Islam 25%
Christianity 13%
Hinduism 0%

I could be a satanist... if they insist [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

title: Re: Meh.
content:
Wow. 100% for Islam. Kinda surprised that I got 100% lol. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

You scored as Islam.

Your beliefs are most similar to those of Islam. Do more research on Islam and possibly consider taking the shahadah and officially becoming a Muslim, if you aren't already. Despite the actions of some - who go against the teachings of Islam - Islam is a religion of peace; the word "islam" means "peace through submission to God." "Muslim" means "one who submits to God." Islam is the third of the three Abrahamic faiths, and it shares much with Judaism in Christianity; its differences are the acceptance of Muhammad as the last and final prophet, and the oneness of God - in other words, that Jesus, though he was a revered prophet, was not in fact God, and only one God exists. Apparently the Taliban could not read (though their name means "students"), because the Qur'an states that men and women are equal as believers, and that all believers should be educated and seek knowledge. Modesty in dress and behavior is required in Islam for both men and women to preserve the values of society and move the emphasis from superificial appearance to intelligence, knowledge, and God.

Islam 100%
Judaism 75%
Paganism 46%
Buddhism 46%
Hinduism 38%
Satanism 29%
Christianity 21%
atheism 8%
agnosticism 0%

Wow. I'm quite surprised with my other results though.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Meh.
content:
I'd like to see what they based that on; whose christianity are they using? Did they consult the Koran? Would people who are these religions agree with all these statements? For example, life is a struggle and we must overcome suffering; is that buddhist? Many christians, atheists nad Ilamics would agree with that 100% And how did they test this? What is its accuracy? I hate tests like these; their average success rate is a little under 5%; barely above chance.

Okay...

Oooh! A tie breaker!

Christianity 79%
Buddhism 79%
Islam 58%
Paganism 50%
Satanism 42%
agnosticism 38%
Judaism 29%
Hinduism 21%
atheism 4%

I like this mix; IMKO Christianity and Buddhisim are almost identical, and Islam is apparently an 'improved' version of christianity [in the way christianity emerged from Judaisim.] Paganisim has some good ideas, satanisim is a load of crap, but makes some good points.

Djaser, perhaps we should pop over to my hose for an intervention...
